intro: Borreria tenella var. crispata, commonly known as the crested borreria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly serrated edge, while the stems are often covered in fine, white hairs. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
